file_content.text: I'm here.
We'd better get to the Senate tower.
Wow. You spend enough time on a backwater like Ord Mantell and you almost forget what a civilized planet is supposed to look like.
I did my officer training here, back before I was deployed to Ord Mantell. There was still a fair bit of reconstruction going on then, rebuilding things the Imperials destroyed.
I still can't believe the Empire managed to sack Coruscant back in the war. The capital of the entire Republic, and they raided it like some Outer Rim mudball.
You'd think our capital would be better defended.
It's hard to believe.
The Republic committed its forces to engaging the Empire on outlying worlds. Defending Coruscant was an afterthought.
It seems like the Empire would've tried to hold onto Coruscant.
I'm surprised we got it back.
Nah, they didn't bring the numbers to actually take over. It was a psych op--sack Coruscant, scare everyone in the Republic. Get people thinking that nobody's safe.
Command was idiotic then, and they're idiotic now.
Sounds typical.
Hindsight's always clearer than foresight, right? We'll never let the Empire take us by surprise again.
Anyways, we should get moving--don't want to keep anyone important waiting.
Vander said to meet General Garza for our new orders. Her office is in the Senate tower.
Let's double-time it, Jorgan.
We'd better get moving.
I'll follow your lead, Lieutenant.
Have you ever heard anything about our new CO?
What do you know about Garza?
Not a lot--but Garza's had the job for a long time now, so she must get results. Let's go find out.
We'd be in the general's office already if you weren't so chatty, Sergeant.
I'm aware of our orders.
Whatever you say. Sir. Let's just move out.
Have you ever been here on Coruscant before, Lieutenant?
I've never made it here to Coruscant. What about you, Sergeant?
No, I haven't.
I'm not much for big cities. Too many shadows, too many angles.
This isn't my kind of place.
I hear you. Urban operations are always a real mess.
You will speak when spoken to, Sergeant. Understood?
Can the chit-chat.
Understood. Sir. Just thought I'd help give you the lay of the land.
Yeah, I'm still here.
